title: How to know in which subject I am interested - Quora

response.answer_text: its not that which subject you are interested.. its which topics you like…like wise you may hate physics but love its practicals or the electrical part and love the mechanics one.. one simple way to realise your favorite one is read a particular topic till the end and try to understand most of it.. now you have done this say 1hr…now ask yoir friends.. look into their study pattern.. they main finish that topic in 3 hr or 6hr…or may be 30 min.. on an average if you master a topic with one or two rounds of readinv then this is the particular topic you are interested in…therr will be atlst one topic which you will love reading.. and just master it more than your friends will.. you know each and every basic points and all.. this is the one for you generally in a subject each and every topic is more or less linked to each other.. and thus if you like one you may find it interesting reading the next two topics…yes there will be some which you wont like that much.. but its ok…. try making a career out of it. as every subject or course haa its own way to success chose the one accordingly…dont ever leave your feild of interest.. as you may like physics.. and you family said you to be doctor.. you may become one but you will not enjoy the things you do… choose the one you like and work hard for it by getting out of your comfort zone.. you will enjoy the stress and be successful.. have a good day friend

Is there anything that has held your attention more than anything else? There must be something that piques your curiosity. The key is to be aware of it. The strange thing is; it may not be something as general as… English. Instead, you may find you're interested in modern American Literature. Or, perhaps there's something about hockey that interests you even a bit. You do some preliminary research and you find that pre-expansion jerseys interest you, or even pre-NHL professional hockey! The point is; stay aware of possible tangential relationships that may flourish for you. Even something as benign as music can stir curiosity. Classic rock has a great sound. You start digging into some bands and you become interested in how many musician were part of multiple bands! There is an infinite amount ideas in the world, there's something bound to garner your attention.

You can analyze yourself by giving multiple task on various subjects. If you find anything to be interesting even little then have a note of it. Give more and more task with that select subject and finally filter few amoung them. Then keep all your books aside and try to imagine about the subjects u elected and then u analyze that which subject made u feel happy and on which subject your imagination power worked quite good. That will be your soul subject and u will shine in that for sure…

Following should help Definitely not by asking anonymous strangers on Quora.Ask your teachers - they know all your academic details and they are usually genuinely interested in helping students. Be honest with them and ask them what area they think your good at.Most importantly -introspection should work. Think about what you feel is your best subject - it usually is your actual one.

If you read all of them for at least 15–20 minutes a day then you will find out which subject you are interested in!! If you don't get bored or feel lazy in any of them then it should mean that you are interested in that particular subject. Thank you

ok sooo you know a simple trick to find that out . Firstly make a list of all subjects you have then cut out your least favorite subjects from it or you know which just dont get into your brain , and then you will see the subjects which are left may be your favorite . Have a try! -aady
